paper_name: Muscarinic acetylcholine receptors: novel opportunities for drug development

pockets.description: Part of the large, solvent-accesible cavity, located at the upper portion of this cavity and termed extracellular verstibule. It is lined with residues that have been implicated in the binding of allosteric modulators.

In the active state of the M2 receptor, the small orthosteric agonist iperoxo engages Asp1033.32 with its cationic head group, whereas the polar isoxazoline tail contacts Asn4046.52 with a single hydrogen bond, paralleling the interactions of the inactive receptor with the antagonist QNB (FIG. 4c).
